pageProps.content:
Experience

John’s Camp lies under a canopy of giant trees with views stretching over the Zambezi River floodplains in Mana Pools National Park – a national park & World Heritage Site.
Mana Pools is big game country at its best & has long enjoyed a reputation as one of the country’s best off-the-beaten-track safari destinations.
As the name suggests, the area has plenty of water year-round – attracting a variety of big game & other wildlife - & therefore providing guests with a fantastic safari experience.
Mana Pools is a fly-in destination that can easily be combined with a trip to Victoria Falls.

Stay

Small & intimate, with only 6 tents, John’s Camp offer their guests the best in luxury & adventure camping.
There are no fences around the camp to allow animals to wander through, which means that John’s Camp accepts children only from the age of 12 unless the camp has been booked on an exclusive-use basis.
Each spacious tent comes complete with solar lighting, en-suite bathrooms & sensational views.
John’s Camp is basic but beautiful & at its centre lies 3 large tents - a kitchen, dining room & lounge – as well as a campfire for chilly evenings.
The romantic star bed is a pop-up gauze tent built on a raised platform – the camp’s alternative venue for the night. Sleeping under the African stars should be on everyone’s bucket list!

Activities

John’s Camp & Mana Pools offer a variety of exhilarating safari activities, including game drives, guided walking safaris where guests can learn about smaller animals & tracking animals on foot.
The romantic star bed sleep-out is a highlight for the more adventurous guest.

subfolders.title: Chikwenya Camp
subfolders.description: The seasonal Chikweyna Camp (open April to November) enjoys an idyllic location in an exclusive-use area in one of Zimbabwe’s prime wildlife regions:  Mana Pools National Park. With jaw-dropping views of the Zambezi River, its floodplains & the distant mountains of the Rift Valley escarpment, photographers often feel like they are in ‘wildlife paradise.’

subfolders.title: John's Camp
subfolders.description: John’s Camp lies under a canopy of giant trees with views stretching over the Zambezi River floodplains in Mana Pools National Park – a national park & World Heritage Site. Mana Pools is big game country at its best & has long enjoyed a reputation as one of the country’s best off-the-beaten-track safari destinations.

subfolders.title: Kanga Camp
subfolders.description: The seasonal Kanga Camp (only open from May – October) is set in a crowd-free private concession within one of Zimbabwe’s prime wildlife regions:  Mana Pools National Park. Kanga Camp offers guests an authentic, adventurous safari experience with a touch of luxury.

subfolders.title: Little Ruckomechi
subfolders.description: Little Ruckomechi is located within the private Ruckomechi Concession & one of only a handful of lodges scattered around Zimbabwe’s Mana Pools National Park.   The camp offers a true wilderness experience combined with ‘just the right amount’ of luxury.  Adventure seekers who are looking for an off-the-beaten-track safari experience will adore Little Ruckomechi.

subfolders.title: Nyamatusi Camp
subfolders.description: Nestled between a grove of large mahogany & sausage trees lies Nyamatusi Camp – one of Mana Pool National Park’s most luxurious safari camps. With air-conditioning & private plunge pools in every suite, guests can experience this wildlife-rich area in style, while still adhering to an eco-friendly & sustainable design.

subfolders.title: Ruckomechi Camp
subfolders.description: Ruckomechi Camp is located on the banks of the hippo-filled Zambezi River & one of only a handful of lodges scattered around Zimbabwe’s Mana Pools National Park.   The camp offers a true wilderness experience combined with ‘just the right amount’ of luxury.  Adventure seekers who are looking for an off-the-beaten-track safari experience will adore Ruckomechi Camp.

subfolders.title: Sapi Explorers Camp
subfolders.description: Sapi Explorers Camp is nestled within a privately-run wildlife reserve – the 120 000 hectares Sapi Concession, next to Zimbabwe’s legendary Mana Pools National Park. The camp lies quite literally a stone’s throw from the Zambezi River, where plenty of animal activity takes place.

subfolders.title: Zambezi Expeditions
subfolders.description: The semi-permanent Zambezi Expeditions is a tented camp (only open from May to October) in the heart of Mana Pools National Park. Small & intimate, Zambezi Expeditions is the ultimate safari destination for adventure-seeking travellers looking for an authentic, back-to-basics safari experience with a little bit of luxury.

whatWeLoveItems: Game-rich location on the Zambezi floodplains
Open 4x4 game drives & guided walking safaris
Excellent wildlife viewing in Mana Pools National Park
Star bed sleep-out under the African stars
